fields.title: Newly Launched Alberta Bus Service & Coach Bus Transportation | MyEBus.ca
fields.text:
Albertans Will Now Have New Daily Scheduled Passenger Bus Service!
ebus launches Thursday, October 20th

 

(Edmonton) – ebus will launch its Edmonton, Red Deer and Calgary daily scheduled passenger bus service on Thursday, October 20th. Albertans now have a choice.

The new ebus passenger service is in direct response to the Provincial Government’s Alberta Transportation Bus Modernization Program. ebus is the first new bus service to offer multiple daily trips in over 30 years.


ebus, General Manager, John Stepovy notes "the public deserves an economical and safe transportation alternative and ebus will offer passengers a new schedule, economical fares, onboard Wireless Internet (Wi-Fi), 110V power-outlets, lap belts and excellent service."


The initial ebus schedule offers passengers a variety of departure options, including; four (4) departures from Edmonton and Calgary (Sunday-Monday-Thursday-Friday), three (3) departures (Tuesday-Wednesday), two (2) departures Saturday. All departures include pick up and drop off in Red Deer.


"As part of our commitment to provide economical fares, ebus is offering Webfares," says Stepovy.  "Passengers will automatically receive a $5 dollar saving every time they book online and people can start booking their reservations effective Monday, October 17th".

Also, as part of its launch ebus will offer the first three seats on every departure for just $1 (one dollar)! The inaugural promotion will apply on all its schedules beginning October 20th and continue until November 30th.  "We are encouraging new passengers to sample our service and we believe our economical fares will definitely motivate more passengers to use ebus.”


ebus will operate from Red Arrow Motorcoach offices and locations in Edmonton, Red Deer and Calgary and will also serve as Ticket Agent for ebus.  “As part of our planning we have heard and listened to Albertans and ebus is the travel alternative they want, it’s economical, efficient, safe and available to everyone in the communities we serve,” says Stepovy.
fields.teaser: eBus has launched a new bus service in Alberta, with daily coach bus transportation to Calgary & Edmonton. Discover affordable bus service with eBus!

fields.title: Our Calgary Bus Transportation Now Offers a Bus to CrossIron Mills | MyEBus.ca
fields.text:
As of January 9, 2012, ebus will begin service to CrossIron Mills in Calgary.

 

The ebus - CrossIron Mills service will operate as follows:  On all Southbound trips from Edmonton and Red Deer, the bus will stop at CrossIron Mills on request only. All Northbound trips out of Calgary to Red Deer and Edmonton will automatically stop at CrossIron Mills.  Pick-up and drop-off location is Entrance #2 (Ranch Entrance).
fields.teaser: As part of our Calgary bus route, eBus now offers a bus to CrossIron Mills. View our bus schedule to find the option that best fits your transportation needs.

fields.title: Offering Low-Cost Bus Service to Fort McMurray | Coach Bus Travel | MyEBus.ca
fields.text:
ebus will be expanding it's network in Alberta and is looking forward to providing it's low-cost, high-comfort bus transportation service to new communities.  The newest bus route that is being added to the ebus schedule is Edmonton to Fort McMurray.  The new service will begin on February 21st, 2012 and booking availability will begin on February 13th, 2012.

 

The new route will run 3 times a week, on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays from Edmonton to Fort McMurray. 

 

"We are very excited to be able to respond to ebus customers' needs and expand our service to Fort McMurray so quickly.  We've received positive response for the my ebus service to-date and look forward to expanding our network in order to further accommodate our customers' needs", states General Manager, John Stepovy.

 

The new bus route will continue to be serviced with ebus' current vehicles, which feature onboard Wireless Internet (Wi-Fi), 110V power-outlets and lap belts.
fields.teaser: eBus, a coach bus service offering affordable transportation in Alberta, now offers a bus from Edmonton to Fort McMurray three times a week.

fields.title: Priority Seating
fields.text:
In our on going effort to provide the best possible comfort and convenience for  travelers, we now offer priority seating for seniors and disabled passengers.

The first two rows on either side of the coach are designated as priority seating with a decal at the window ledge.

fields.title: New 7:15am Early Bird Trips From Fort McMurray to Edmonton
fields.text:
Our passengers have spoken - they want more trips at a more convenient time and they want to know that this service is available for booking when they want it, and at a reasonable price.   We’re in the people business and making our passengers happy is important. That’s why ebus is introducing more trips between Edmonton and Fort McMurray than ever!

 

Early birds will appreciate the new ebus 7:15am departure from Fort McMurray to Edmonton.   Not only does this ebus leave for Edmonton earlier than any other bus service, but you can connect to trips heading to Red Deer and Calgary earlier than ever.  The safe and reliable Early Bird 7:15am ebus runs every Monday to Friday.  Now you can plan your day ahead, depart early and arrive in Edmonton in plenty of time for an afternoon appointment, a late lunch with friends, or an early start to your weekend in the city.  If Edmonton is home, you’ll be home earlier than ever to enjoy the rest of your day.

 

For those heading up to Fort McMurray from Edmonton ebus has introduced a new 3:45pm departure running Sunday through Thursday.  Beat the rush out of the city and wrap up your day with a relaxing trip north.

 

Every ebus is equipped with FREE WIFI, power outlets, and a convenient onboard restroom.  Also, for your safety, each ebus seat has a lap belt.  Combine all this with 30% more leg room and you’re set for a safe, restful, and comfortable trip.

 

As John Stepovy, General Manager, says “We want to make your trip be best travel experience we can.  We’re happy to offer these new trips between Edmonton and Fort McMurray, and we look forward to welcoming you onboard.”

 

Check out the Fort McMurray Schedule, book your trip online and save $5.00 today!

fields.title: New Service to  Beaver, Athabasca and Henday, Wapasu Lodges
fields.text:
ebus Announces New Service to  Beaver, Athabasca and Henday, Wapasu Lodges 
 
ebus, Alberta’s economical, efficient and safe coach service is now serving the Beaver, Athabasca, Henday, Wapasu Lodges  both to and from Edmonton with connections through to Calgary began on August 1, 2013.
 
John Stepovy, General Manager, has this to say about this new service, “We’re really excited about being able to expand our services to the PTI lodges in the Fort McMurray area. These new trips are a great opportunity for us to further serve the communities of Alberta. We look forward to welcoming our new passengers on board.”
 
In addition to this new service, ebus continues to provide outstanding affordable transportation to Edmonton, Calgary, Red Deer, CrossIron Mills and Fort McMurray, with several stops in smaller Alberta communities such as Wandering River, Marianna Lakes, Grassland, St. Albert, and Athabasca. Every ebus is equipped with Free WIFI, power outlets, and a convenient on board restroom.  For your safety and peace of mind, every ebus seat is equipped with a lap belt.  Because we want our passengers to be extra comfortable, we also have 30% more leg room so you can stretch out and reclining seats to help you relax during your safe, restful, and comfortable trip with us.
 
For fares and schedules check out the ebus schedule. You’ll save $5.00 off your trip when you book your trip online.  Visit ebus on Facebook at www.facebook.com/ebus3 and follow us on Twitter @travelebus for more news, specials and contests.

fields.title: We'll Get You There - Summer Campaign
fields.text:
We’ll Get You There

Summer Campaign

Red Arrow and ebus in partnership with Travel Alberta is showcasing some of the best events happening in Alberta.  With ebus traveling to the top destinations in the province, including Edmonton, Red Deer, Calgary, and Fort McMurray, experiencing the best events this province has to offer is as easy as booking a ticket and heading on the road to adventure.   Take a look at some of the events and visit their websites, then book your seat on ebus.  We’ll get you there!

 

Where to Stay:

iHotel (www.hi67.com)

Here’s an idea.  If you’re traveling to/from Red Deer, stay at the iHotel!  Red Arrow makes daily pick-up/drop-offs at this handy location at 6500 67 Street in Red Deer. What could be more convenient? Visit their website to see for yourself.

Holiday Inn Express Edmonton (www.hiexdowntown.com)

Summer in Edmonton means fun, festivals and friends.  Make your travel arrangements simple. Take the Red Arrow to and from downtown Edmonton and stay at the Holiday Inn Express right next door to our Red Arrow downtown ticket office at 10010 104th Street, NW. The Holiday Inn Express offers 140 recently renovated guestrooms within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and movie theatres. They have jacuzzi suites, king sized beds and so much more. Check out their website for details.

What to See and Do

Edmonton Fringe Festival – August 15-25, 2013

The Edmonton International Fringe Theatre Festival is back in action, celebrating Bond’s 50 years on screen. Join us for danger, excitement, adventure and theatre cutting across churches, bars and boudoirs in Old Strathcona and beyond at From Fringe with Love, August 15 – 25, 2013. The Fringe is the Number 1 target for SPECTRE-U: Special Executive for Comedy, Tears, Renegades and Entertainment — Unjuried and Uncensored! SPECTRE-U agents come from around the city, the country and the globe to charm Edmontonians of all ages with theatrical performances, plus busking acts, children’s activities, vendors, artisans and more. The Festival, powered by Her Majesty’s Volunteer Service, celebrates Fringe Theatre Adventures’ new vision that everyone is fringing!

(www.fringetheatreadventurs.ca)

 

Calgary International Blues Festival (www. Calgarybluesfest.com)

July 29-August 4

The 9th annual Calgary International Blues Festival features a full week of the best in blues, culminating in 4 days and nights of non-stop music at Shaw Millenium Park (1220 9th Ave. SW). Starring renowned guitar great  Jimmie Vaughan and the Tilt-A-Whirl Band featuring Lou Ann Barton,  powerhouse singer  Sista Monica ,  Canadian giants  Tom Lavin & the Legendary Powder Blues,  Motown classics  Martha Reeves & the Vandellas,  Canadian icon  Matt Minglewood and a host of other blues greats, get your dancin' shoes on and get ready for the time of your life!

                                                                                

 

 

 

Calgary Chasing Summer Festival (www.chasingsummerfestival.com)

August 9-10

Prepare yourself for two days of incredible music!

 

Calgary GlobalFest (link: www.globalfest.ca)

August 16-25

GlobalFest burst onto the scene in 2003 with 10 cultural pavilions and three countries presenting pyromusicals in Calgary's very own international fireworks festival. On the fourth and final night of the festival, GlobalFest celebrated a remarkable accomplishment. The festival reached attendance of close to 100,000 in the very first year, making GlobalFest one of Calgary's top draws for local citizens and tourists alike. GlobalFest's mandate as a not-for-profit society is to produce an inclusive, world class, multi-faceted arts and culture festival that celebrates and showcases cultural diversity and artistic excellence within our communities and across the globe.

Calgary xFest ( www.xfestcalgary.com)

August 31-Sept1

X-FEST returns for a third year at historic Fort Calgary. Produced by UnionEvents.com and presented by Calgary’s New Rock Alternative X92.9, X-FEST has become one of western Canada’s premiere summer music events. Previous performers include Linkin Park, Jane’s Addiction, fun., Silversun Pickups, The Joy Formidable, House of Pain, and Social Distortion. This year’s event has grown to encompass the Labour Day Long Weekend, with two days of amazing modern rock to enjoy on August 31st and September 1st.

More to Explore:

Lethbridge Galt Museum (www.galtmuseum.com)

Visit the Galt Museum in Lethbridge for a summer of events and tours for you and your entire family. The Galt Museum & Archives engages and educates our communities in the human history of southwestern Alberta by preserving and sharing collections, stories and memories that define our collective identity and guide our future.

 

Lethbridge Helen Shuler Nature Centre ( link: http://www.lethbridge.ca/Things-To-Do/Nature-Centre/Pages/default.aspx)

Explore and enjoy the unique urban escape within minutes of downtown Lethbridge.  Full summer program (link to pdf: http://www.lethbridge.ca/Things-To-Do/Nature-Centre/Documents/summer%20programs%202013.pdf)   Opened in 1982, the Helen Schuler Nature Centre is operated by the City of Lethbridge. In its first year of operation, over 8,500 people visited the Nature Centre and took part in the programs. By 1984, more space was needed, so an additional programming room and offices were added. The Nature Centre has changed and grown with the community, and now receives more than 30,000 visitors each year!

Lethbridge Nikka Yuko Japanese Garden (www.nikkayuko.com)

The Nikka Yuko Japanese Garden offers you an unforgettable experience, combining the beauty of nature in a serene setting. From the first spring blossom to the final autumn leaf, the Garden is an oasis of tranquility. Step through the entrance gate, leave the bustle of everyday city life behind, and refresh your senses. A host or hostess in traditional Japanese clothing will greet you and highlight the Garden's many features, or give you a guided tour. 

 

Lethbridge Exhibition Park (www. Exhibitionpark.ca)

Exhibition Park, also known as Lethbridge & District Exhibition, the fourth oldest Agriculture Society in Alberta. Since the first fair in 1897, it has hosted more than a century of agriculture, tradeshows, midways, rodeos, sporting events, and numerous special events. Visit the website for a full calendar of events

 

Claresholm Fair Days (www.townofclaresholm.com)

August 9-11

Join the town for a parade and events for the whole family over three days. This years Bench Show theme is “4H- Head, Heart, Hands & Health”. More a full list of events please click here (link: http://www.townofclaresholm.com/visit/events-calendar/)

 

Fort McMurray Tourism – (www.fortmcmurraytourism.com)

 

Fort McMurray is one of 11 communities that comprise the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo. The other communities in our region include Anzac, Conklin, Draper, Fort Chipewyan, Fort Fitzgerald, Fort McKay, Gregoire Lake Estates, Janvier, Mariana Lake and Saprae Creek Estates. What a great place to visit! For events and tourist information, please visit the main website.

fields.title: New ebus Service to PTI Anzac Lodge, PTI Conklin Lodge, Conklin (Conklin Corners), and Lac La Biche
fields.text:

ebus Alberta’s economical, efficient and safe daily scheduled service motorcoach company, has announced new services to PTI Anzac Lodge, PTI Conklin Lodge, Conklin (Conklin Corners), and Lac La Biche.

The new ebus service will operate from the downtown Edmonton ticket office located at the Holiday Inn Express Plaza, 10014-104th street, to PTI Anzac Lodge and back the same day, every Wednesday, Thursday and Friday.

John Stepovy, General Manager, states “The expansion of our ebus to serve these communities is an exciting opportunity. Our new service begins on November 13th, in time for the busy travel season. In addition to providing service to these towns, this new ebus service will provide valuable transportation services to the many camp workers in the areas. Safety is our first Core Value and is at the heart of everything we do. We remain committed to providing excellent service and getting our passengers safely home. We look forward to welcoming our passengers on board these new routes.”

In addition to this new service, ebus continues to provide outstanding affordable transportation to Edmonton, Calgary, Red Deer, CrossIron Mills and Fort McMurray, with several stops in other Alberta communities such as Wandering River, Marianna Lakes, Grassland, St. Albert, and Athabasca. ebus also services Barge Landing Lodge, Creeburn Lake Lodge, and Beaver, Athabasca, Henday, and Wapasu Lodges in the Fort McMurray area.

For full schedule information please visit our schedules page.

fields.title: ebus Service to Edmonton International Airport
fields.text:
ebus Announces Expanded Service to Edmonton International Airport

(Edmonton) ebus is pleased to announce further expansion of their Alberta scheduled motorcoach service to include Edmonton International Airport starting May 9th, 2015. “This is a great opportunity for Alberta travelers, “says John Stepovy, Director of Sales and Business Development, Red Arrow & ebus. “Once again we have listened to our passengers’ suggestions. This new direct service to Edmonton International Airport will be very handy for those passengers making airline connections or simply traveling between Edmonton, Calgary and Red Deer. We’re really excited about expanding this service to Alberta travelers.”


The ebus service will offer four trips daily, 7 days a week, through Edmonton International Airport. ebus will make stops at the airport at 12:00pm and 6:30pm for southbound passengers heading to Red Deer and Calgary, and 2:30pm and 9:15pm for northbound passengers traveling from Calgary and Red Deer. Detailed schedules and fares can be found on the ebus website at www.myebus.ca.


ebus is known as Alberta’s economical, efficient and safe coach transportation company, offering affordable fares with a $5.00 savings when trips are booked online. Each comfortable ebus coach offers complimentary WIFI, 48 reclining seats, power outlets, lap belts, on-board lavatory, and ample leg room and luggage space, along with the safety and peace of mind that comes along with Alberta’s friendliest and most skilled drivers.


“We are delighted to support this great new option for Central and Southern Albertans to get to and from Edmonton International Airport” says Kirstin Brown, Manager of Regional Sales Development at Edmonton International Airport.


“Working with the amazing team at Edmonton International Airport, we’re excited to be able to expand our direct service from Edmonton, Red Deer and Calgary, to include the Edmonton International Airport,” says John Stepovy. “To the cost conscious traveler, ebus is an easy connection to EIA and its 60 plus non-stop destinations including Icelandair.”


With an extensive network of scheduled routes for reliable, safe transportation across the province, ebus specializes in daily scheduled motorcoach service to and from Edmonton, Red Deer, Calgary, Fort McMurray and CrossIron Mills, as well as direct service to and from camps in the Fort McMurray and Conklin regions. ebus also offers private charter and shuttle service throughout Alberta. ebus is operated by Red Arrow Motorcoach and is part of the Pacific Western Group of Companies.

fields.title: Ready for an adventure? Let’s go to Iceland!
fields.text:
This northern country has an area of only 102,775 kilometers (approx. 39,700 square miles) and a population of 329,000. Home to music, natural wonders, art, and world famous dining, Iceland is well worth exploring.   Travelers from all around the world visit Iceland as either their main destination for a holiday or as a stop-over for a couple of days when traveling to/from Europe.  (Map courtesy of Lonely Planet)


Edmonton International Airport has direct service to Iceland via Icelandair.


The capital of Iceland is Reykjavik. This city is world famous for its history, natural beauty, culture and more.  The population of Reykjavik is only around 120,000 so you can be assured you will not run into the expected capital city chaos you might find elsewhere.  This is truly a city best explored on foot or on a bicycle. Take a walk through the Reykjavik Art Museum and the National Gallery, enjoy some popular local music, and end your day with the vibrant nightlight. Day-excursions from Reykjavik are popular and there is something for everyone and every taste. Horseback riding, rafting, cave exploration, whale watching, gallery tours, swimming, shopping, glacier hikes, are just a few of the exciting adventures sure to tempt you.  Don’t forget to consider taking a trip to the new music and conference centre, Harpa.

 

Explore East Iceland, where lush farms, small fjords and islands, natural harbors and fishing villages await you.  Europe’s largest glacier, Vatnajokull, is found here. Don’t let the quaint landscape fool you; look closer. Music and arts festivals draw people from around the world, making East Iceland a cultural hotspot.

 

Head to West Iceland to discover Iceland’s waterfalls, sleeping volcanoes and geologic wonders like no other place on Earth.  Feel like going for a hike? Head to the Akranes and Hvalfjorour and see the highest waterfall in the country.  Snaefellsjokull National Park and the famous Snaefellsjokull Glacier are must see. And for eco-tourists, Snaefellsnes received the 2008 Earth Check award for being a sustainable community. It’s truly a must-see destination.

 

The Westfjords, located in the North West of Iceland is mainly uninhabited and unspoiled wilderness. Considered one of the country’s best kept secrets, this natural environment is captivating and perfect for photographers and explorers. This area is home to the birdcliff Latrabjarb, which is reported to hosts nearly half of the world’s population of several bird species. It is also a nature reserve and safe haven for the Arctic Fox.

 

The countries most visited tourist attractions are located along the South coast of Iceland. Fresh seafood, friendly people, charming towns, all awaits both adventurer and leisure traveler alike.  Natural wonders such as Skogafoss Waterall, Jokulsarlon Glacial Lagoon, are easy to get to.  Ready to grab a spectacular meal? The South of Iceland is known for its amazing restaurants and fresh seafood.

 

The Keflavik International Airport is located in the famous Reykjanes Peninsula. This geothermal area is where the Hellisheioi Power Station is.  Visitors can check out the geothermal energy exhibition and learn about the ways Iceland has harnessed the energy from the geothermal activity to generate electricity. The entire area is a geologists dream. Caves, lava fields, hot springs, volcanic craters, geothermal water, all showcase the power of the Earth.  At the same time, this area is well known for its great restaurants, several museums and festivals.

 

Head to the highlands of Iceland, located in the interior. This area is a natural mosaic mixing volcanoes, ice caps, hot springs, valleys and rocky deserts all I one place. Two mountain roads, Kjolur and Sprengisandur take you to a hilly expanse of breathtaking beauty. Take advantage of a guided tour in a 4x4 vehicle in the summer and make camp at the popular basecamp location in the woodland nature reserve Posmork.  Want to rest your weary bones after a long day of exploring? The area of Landmannalauger has natural hot geothermal rivers travelers can bathe in.

 

North Iceland is nothing but spectacular. Mountains, lava fields, lush vegetation contrasting against barren seasons, the contrast of environmental scenes is a photographer’s dream.  The northern latitude is close to the Arctic Circle, giving visitors breathtaking view of the midnight sun.

 

ebus offers direct service from Edmonton, Red Deer, and Calgary to Edmonton International Airport. From the airport hop Icelandair for a direct flight to Iceland and start your Icelandic adventure!

fields.title: Policy Change
fields.text: Effective May 1, 2016, the 7 Day Flex Fare will no longer be offered.  Only Standard Fares will be offered.  Standard fares will be non-refundable and non-transferrable.  Tickets purchased must be used for the date and time originally booked.  Time changes will only be permitted if passenger is upgrading to a Red Arrow departure on the same day.  Red Arrow tickets that have been upgraded from ebus are also non-refundable.   Missed departures will result in forfeiture of fare and a new full fare will need to be purchased for travel.
